title: Blockchain-Powered forex Market
description: Most African currencies are not listed on the international forex market.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has submitted the same proposal 5 times (3 times in the developer ecosystem, once in grow Africa and once in NFT business models).
It is not clear how an FX exchange is related to the developer ecosystem. The description of why this would be useful focusses on users not having access to local currency pairs.
f6_assessments.q1:
No real plan has been presented and a statement that "We have developed and tested a blockchain-powered forex trading platform" doesn't mean much without evidence. Each of the 5 proposals submitted has some small change in this experience. If they had done them all, why not add all of them to every proposal?

What countries/currency pairs do you expect to add?

How are you going to market the project? 50,000 demo users in 3 months? Why do you think you can achieve this? (interesting to note this is half the expected number of demo users as the cryptocurrency exchange proposal)
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has given deliverables, timelines and numbers of users and in that sense progress would be easy to audit. Though the numbers seem to be too high to be achievable (50,000 demo users in 3 months with no marketing plan?).
f6_assessments.reply: Each proposal addresses different problems and solutions, however, they have some similarities but operate independently. The project is ready for production,  so there is no feasibility issue. Project URL and teste users were available on the plan detail. The team has proven experience with a working product. Value for Cardano blockchain is visible, stable coins and CBDCs(Central bank digital currencies) will most likely be issued on the Cardano blockchain. All African currencies pairs will be available. Also, few are listed on the pilot project.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is sketchy and does not include team size, the status of regulatory compliances, and the proposer's experience. Moreover, the proposal provides no value addition to the developer ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: There are minimal details regarding the past experience of the proposer or his team. The demo website is sketchy and does not have any details on backend implementation. Forex exchange operation is very involved and a high-risk operation. The white paper does not contain an approach or a plan to implement. Therefore it isn't easy to expect that the proposal will be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: The aim and the final state expected are fairly clear, but the proposal lacks serious implementation details. The procurement of exchange software license, and pay for only two devs are not sufficient details in a proposal of this scale. The most important issue is that the success of this proposal will not in any way improver the developer ecosystem in Cardano.
f6_assessments.reply: Team experience is presented with a working product. The technical part of the project has already been accomplished. There may be challenges in the strategy implementation but that will be solved accordingly.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal wants to create a platform for forex market which does not align with the challenge. This proposal won't help developers. The proposal would've been much more suited in another challenge. The idea itself has meaning, together with the whitepaper it provides a vision of why and what the proposers plan to do. Given that it does not fit the challenge I strongly disagree that this proposal addresses the challenge. I would suggest for the next funding to find a better-suited challenge. Grow Africa, Grow Cardano would've been a better challenge for this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers give a link to the website of the test market but don't provide any necessary evidence of background information to go with. The budget breakdown needs more information to assess why the amount is needed. Hosting a web server doesn't require 30.000 for a year, and the other dev tools are not explained what these are or why they are needed. Being that there already is a demo version of the proposal is a good sign that the proposers are engaged in the idea. The success timeline provided is a bit bland and doesn't provide the info needed to evaluate the success of the proposal. You state that the launch date is in February 2023 but in the success timeline you speak of a product launch after six months. This leaves a gap in the timeline of about a nin months. Due to the lack of information, I don't see this proposal being implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: This is a great idea to help the people of Africa but since we lack so much information in the proposal it is hard to assess this. We need a more detailed plan to provide the auditability with a guideline to follow. Provide background information of the team to give the proposal some credibility. Provide a roadmap of milestones you wish to accomplish and maybe a starting date because now there is a gap of 9months in the timetable.
f6_assessments.reply: Realistic feedback. A  dedicated server that can handle this type of workload costs more than $30,000 a year. So much work already done and technically feasible.

f6_assessments.q0: This project is about to develop a blockchain based forex market. This challenge however is about improving the developer ecosystem. As this project as an application, it does not fit into this challenge. Also, there is no linkage to the Cardano blockchain mentioned in the proposal. Therefore, a funding would be unfair to the other proposals in this challenge, that fit perfectly into it.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no proof-of-life of the team. No references or links are provided. The team provides access to a demo account of a forex platform. We don't even know if the linked forex platform is made by the proposer or someone else because there is no information either in the proposal nor on the website. There is no link to Cardano, no go-to-market strategy. The budget is for two developers, but we don't know what they will develop. 70k is for a trade-matching software that is not explained. All-in-all this does not provide sufficient information to assess feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: This is a completely non-transparent proposal that includes no proof-of-life and no documentation possibilities. The roadmap without a detailed description of the activities is useless. Metrics like users without context where they come from as well. If these proposers take all the things I mentioned here to heart, they will have a better chance in the next round.
f6_assessments.reply: We tried to make our proposal brief and readable for the voter. The impact on the Cardano ecosystem is Visbel and enormous. The probability of adopting Cardano to issues stable coins at the government level is most likely to happen if this type of working product is available. So much work already done. The pilot project URL were already provided, however, team detail is not provided.

solution: We will Provide a blockchain-powered forex market that supports all African and other's national currencies.
experience: We have developed and tested a blockchain-powered forex trading platform.
